title: Ekko?
body: I have been plays a lot of games with ekko latly. I have decided to main him. What can i expect for ekko in the future? will he be buffed nerfed, or just kept the same. I honestly dont have an opinion on this i just want to ask the balencing team where ekko is headed.

replies.body: We don't have any current plans for Ekko, so it's quite likely he'll be unchanged for at least a few patches.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Lylcz2ce,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-10-18T00:57:14.998+0000)
>
> We don't have any current plans for Ekko, so it's quite likely he'll be unchanged for at least a few patches.

Do you have any plans for Diana or Lux? To me they seem a bit on the strong side for the last few patchs.

We're keeping an eye on both, with Lux especially looking like she might be too strong. No immediate plans that I know of for either of them though, in part because preseason's coming up soon and that'll shake up balance in general, so it's possible they may not need any changes after that.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Lylcz2ce,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2015-10-18T01:58:49.424+0000)

please don't nerf Lux, she is finally viable, but not insanely overpowered. People are just upset because they haven't had to learn to play against her. at least give Lux some time to be in the spotlight to see if people can learn to adjust against her much like they learned to play against people like Yasuo, etc.

Lux has always been viable. She was sitting at 52% win rate before her buffs. Now she's edging on 56%. She's too strong at the moment. Not overpowered, but her unnecessary buffs were, well, unnecessary. This is coming from someone who enjoys playing Lux from time to time, before and after her nerfs.

> [{quoted}](name=Frozen Beauty,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Lylcz2ce,comment-id=00000000000100000001,timestamp=2015-10-18T06:08:05.993+0000)

Not overpowered, but her unnecessary buffs were, well, unnecessary. This is coming from someone who enjoys playing Lux from time to time, before and after her nerfs.

she didnt get any damage buffs. the only damage buff sort of is the second binding is now the same as first. which is a moderate buff at best. the rest were quality of life that made her a lot more fluid to use.

i don't think they should revert the E or W change if they do nerf. if they want to revert the Q back to half damage on second binding thats ok. but the other two just made her a lot smoother to play. the insta cast shield is so nice as it actually allows you to counterplay people who going to burst you. and the E insta detonate is perfect for landing it now. The Q was the only real damage buff.

I wish people would stop acting like she was immensely buffed or something.
almost all AP items got buffed that patch, indirectly buffing _all_ mages in the entirety of League as a whole (yes, even Yorick)
Yorick scales better off of AD though.

Actually her buffs made her  lane more effectively. The only buff I'd probably remove atleast  is the mana cost on Q and range increase of slow on E ( which they only increased for those with higher ping if I am correct)

The secondary buffs like full snare on Q on secondary target (I wouldn't mind if this were removed aswell), midflight activation (gragas got this too), and immediate shield aplication are quite "healthy" buffs.

Lux, compared to other "control"/ "burst" mages is still weaker what they can do compared to her. She still needs 3 items if not more to  clear a whole minion wave. It's ridicilous that she can't kill caster minions with one full maxed E. cough cough Viktor, Velkoz, Ziggs, Anivia, Azir, Xerath.

I agree she was always strong, the reason why her winrate went up is also because more people picked her up aswell. 56 % doesn't mean a champion is unbalanced, some are balanced at 48%, some at 50% and some at 55%.

I don't mind the nerfs but I really want to see what balance team will do, cause sometimes their  choices are well questionable.
